event.summary: 04/18/1993: Two armed men from the Marxist military wing of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, the Red Eagles, entered the Offices of the European Development Agency in Gaza City and told all the Palestinians to get on the ground and then stabbed, hacked, and shot to death Ilan Feinberg.
event.gname: Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP)
event.motive: Possible reprisal for the attempted assassination of Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine leader Samir Suwaden and the death of his wife and daughter by an Israeli helicopter attack in South Lebanon.
event.weapdetail: Knives, Hatchet, and AK-47 assault rifles
event.scite1: Derek Brown, "Israeli Murdered as Talks are Postponed; Ban on Arabs crossing from occupied zone to go on," The Guardian (London), April 19, 1993.
event.scite2: Jon Immanuel, Michael Rotem and Raine Marcus, "Ramat Gan Lawyer murdered in Gaza Ian Feinberg worked for agency aiding Palestinians," The Jerusalem Post, April 19, 1993.
event.scite3: Michael Parks, "Israeli Lawyer Working with Palestinians Hacked to Death," Los Angeles Times, April 19, 1993.
